Chapter II

The birth of a tyrant

Exactly one year after his election, 7 080 drug suspects have been killed and 4 146 have been executed outside police operations.

RODRIGUO DUTERTE, THE PUNISHER

rodriguo duterte

alias "the punisher"

birth

28 of March 1945 in Maasin

family

Father lawyer and governor of Davao

career

1977 - 1979 | Special Counsel
1979 - 1986 | Assistant City Prosecutor
1986 - 1988 | Officer-in-charge vice mayor of Davao
1988 - 1998 | Mayor of Davao
1998 - 2001 | Congressman of Davao City
2001 - 2010 | Mayor of Davao
2010 - 2013 | Vice Mayor

THE ETERNAL KING OF DAVAO

DAVAO DEAD SQUAD

1 040 people

were killed by the Davao Death Squad (DDS) between 1998 and 2008.

On the order of former Davao mayor, Rodrigo Duterte, assailants were provided in weapons and informations by the local police. Most of the time, it was a shoot to kill policy, killing people without arrest.

Testimony

Amnesty International

Testimony

Philippines people

A CONTROVERSIAL CHARACTER

HITLER

« Hitler massacred three million Jews. Now, there is three million drug addicts. I'd be happy to slaughter them. »

HUMAN RIGHTS

« Forget the laws on human rights. You drug pushers and do-nothings, you better go out. Because I'd kill you »

RAPE

« I saw her face and I thought, ‘They raped her, they all lined up. She was so beautiful. I thought, the mayor should have been first. »

POPE

« We were affected by the traffic. I wanted to call him: 'Pope, son of a whore, go home. Do not visit us again’. »

THE RISE TO POWER : HOW DID HE GETS HERE ?

DISENCHANTMENT
AMERICAN ELITISM
CORRUPTION
INEQUALITIES
CLOSE TO THE PEOPLE

Seduce the electorate by surfing on existing threats, adopt a victimization discourse and play on despair.

People were tired of a country pro-liberal, subject to american control.

The country is very submitted to corruption, especially in the security forces which are corrupted by 40% according to the president himself

Despite promising numbers in recent years, continues to see inequalities widening. The rate of growth is more than 6% but corruption continues to plague public affairs.

Most of his electorate advances the fact that he is close to the people, similar to the people, for having voted for him

WHO GAVE HIM POWER

16 601 997 people

people have voted for Rodrigo Duterte.

86%

of Filipinos have "trust" in the President's performance.

DR LORRAINE BADOY

DOCTOR AND NGO VOLUNTEER

thought

former president Aquino ineptly handled the tragedy and she is convinced that Duterte, by contrast, is a man of action. Because she believes his heart is truly in public service and helping poor people. She thinks he's done "amazing things."

« He got things done that other presidents haven’t »
